title: Ohio State Income Tax Calculator | Authoritative, Fast & Accessible

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Given annual gross income G, pretax percent p, pretax fixed F, exemptions count n, per-exemption amount E, municipal rate r_m, school rate r_s: Ohio AGI (after pretax): \( \mathrm{AGI}_{OH} = \max\{0,\, G - (p/100)\cdot G - F \} \) Exemptions deduction: \( D = n \cdot E(\mathrm{AGI}_{OH}) \) Ohio taxable income: \( T = \max\{0,\, \mathrm{AGI}_{OH} - D \} \) State tax using bracket i with threshold a_i, base tax b_i, and marginal rate r_i: \( \mathrm{Tax}_{state} = \begin{cases} 0, & T \le a_1 \\ b_i + r_i \cdot (T - a_i), & a_i < T \le a_{i+1} \end{cases} \) Municipal tax: \( \mathrm{Tax}_{muni} = r_m/100 \cdot T \) School district tax: \( \mathrm{Tax}_{school} = r_s/100 \cdot T \) Total Ohio taxes: \( \mathrm{Tax}_{total} = \mathrm{Tax}_{state} + \mathrm{Tax}_{muni} + \mathrm{Tax}_{school} \) Net income: \( \mathrm{Net} = G - (p/100)\cdot G - F - \mathrm{Tax}_{total} \)

variables.meaning: property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
